metadata.title: CVE-2019-9498 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The implementations of EAP-PWD in hostapd EAP Server, when built against acrypto library missing explicit validation on imported elements, do notvalidate the scalar and element values in EAP-pwd-Commit. An attacker maybe able to use invalid scalar/element values to complete authentication,gaining session key and network access without needing or learning thepassword. Both hostapd with SAE support and wpa_supplicant with SAE supportprior to and including version 2.4 are affected. Both hostapd with EAP-pwdsupport and wpa_supplicant with EAP-pwd support prior to and includingversion 2.7 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.4-0ubuntu6.4
wpagui - 2.4-0ubuntu6.4
wpasupplicant - 2.4-0ubuntu6.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu6.4').
